Class AStarSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • AStarSearch

  • public class AStarSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that is used to hold the data structures and behaviours to carry out the A Star (A*) search algorithm on the puzzle to be solved, using the heuristic choice made by the user the command line arguments.
    Author:
    Dale Peters (dmp9@aber.ac.uk)

      • getNodesExpanded

        public int getNodesExpanded()

      • findPath

        public Path findPath(GridState startState,
            GridState targetState,
            java.lang.String heuristic)
        Carries out the A Star (A*) search algorithm based on the heuristic chosen by the user in the command line arguments in order to attempt to find the shortest path from the Initial State to the Target State. If the third argument passed in to this method is "manhattan", it will use the Manhattan Distance heuristic (the sum of the distances each tile is away from where it should be, as defined by the target state) to attempt to find a path from the start state to the target state. If the third argument passed in to this method is "hamming", it will use the Hamming Distance heuristic (the number of tiles not in the place where they should be, according to the target state) to attempt to find a path from the start state to the target state. This method is based on the pseudo code found at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm
        Parameters:
        startState - The state in which the puzzle starts at.
        targetState - The state in which the algorithm is to try and achieve as a result of carrying out the algorithm.
        heuristic - A description of the heuristic the user wishes to use to solve the problem.
        Returns:
        The path the algorithm generated from the starting state to the goal state. Returns null if the algorithm failed.

      • calculateHammingDistance

        public int calculateHammingDistance(GridState current,
                           GridState target)
        Calculates the number of tiles in the particular state that are out of place from the target state. Used in the case that the user chose to ask the software to solve the problem using the Hamming Distance heuristic.
        Parameters:
        current - The state to calculate the number of misplaced tiles for.
        target - The targetState the algorithm is trying to find a path to get to.
        Returns:
        The number of misplaced tiles in the current state.

      • calculateManhattanDistance

        public int calculateManhattanDistance(GridState current,
                             GridState target)
        Calculates the sum of the distances each tile is away from where it should be, as defined by the target state passed in. Used in the case that the user chose to ask the software to solve the problem using the Manhattan Distance heuristic.
        Parameters:
        current - The state to calculate the Manhattan Distance for.
        target - The targetState the algorithm is trying to find a path to get to.
        Returns:
        The sum of the distances each tile is away from where it should be.
